questions.question: What deeper issue is suggested when Mafalda says, “Because it's how this world works, Guille!”?
options: The natural curiosity of children about life
The criticism of a society where work dominates life
The importance of respecting adults
The idea that children should not ask too many questions
questions.answer: The criticism of a society where work dominates life

questions.question: When Mafalda ends with “One and a half and already a candidate for tear gas,” what is she implying about Guille?
options: He is too young to understand work
He is already showing a rebellious or questioning spirit
He is ready to get a job soon
He simply enjoys bothering his sister
questions.answer: He is already showing a rebellious or questioning spirit

questions.question: How does Mafalda's reaction challenge the idea of an “ideal life”?
options: By showing that a perfect plan can still feel empty
By suggesting that happiness comes from following lists
By proving that children don't understand adult goals
By encouraging people to plan every single step of life
questions.answer: By showing that a perfect plan can still feel empty

questions.question: If Mafalda thinks the life shown is “a list,” what quality does she believe is missing?
options: Spontaneity and true experiences
More responsibilities and duties
Better organization and structure
A longer list with more activities

questions.question: What does Mafalda's mother mean by saying she is “the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund”?
options: She controls the household rules like financial institutions control countries
She is simply joking with Mafalda
She wants Mafalda to study economics
She means she has more money than Mafalda
questions.answer: She controls the household rules like financial institutions control countries

questions.question: Why does Mafalda think, “That was clever”?
options: Because her mother used humor to end the argument
Because her mother gave her permission to disobey
Because she realized her mother doesn’t understand politics
Because her mother actually picked up the sweater
questions.answer: Because her mother used humor to end the argument

questions.question: If Calvin were writing a diary about the new girl, what would he most likely write?
options: “She's amazing, I want to be her friend!”
“Who cares? Not me!”
“Her name is Sarah, and she's really nice”
“I already like her a lot”
questions.answer: “Her name is Sarah, and she's really nice”

questions.question: Why does Hobbes probably think Calvin does like the new girl?
options: Because Calvin is shouting “NO!” too strongly
Because Calvin is smiling when he talks about her
Because Calvin wrote her name on his notebook
Because Calvin said she’s the nicest person ever
questions.answer: Because Calvin is shouting “NO!” too strongly

questions.question: If Snoopy could answer Linus, what would he probably say?
options: “Make me!”
“Okay, here you go”
“Blankets are my new chew toy”
“I only obey Charlie Brown”

questions.question: What lesson does this comic secretly teach about words?
options: Sometimes dogs are smarter than humans
Timing and tone can change meaning
Blankets are the most powerful objects
Snoopy always wins in the end
questions.answer: Timing and tone can change meaning
